name: fortinet-fortirecon-easm
label: Fortinet FortiRecon EASM
description: FortiRecon is a Digital Risk Protection Service (DRPS) product that provides an outside-the-network view to the risks posed to your enterprise.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.name: server_url
fields.description: Server name or IP address to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.tooltip: Server name or IP address to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.title: API Key
fields.name: api_key
fields.description: API key to access the endpoint server to which you connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.tooltip: API key to access the endpoint server to which you connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.name: org_id
fields.title: Organization ID
fields.description: The organization ID on which FortiRecon operations are to be performed.
fields.tooltip: The organization ID on which FortiRecon operations are to be performed.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified. By default, this option is selected, i.e., set to True.
fields.tooltip: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.
fields.name: verify_ssl

operations.description: Retrieves a list of leaked credentials related to the organization ID based on the keyword to search, breach ID, and date-time range you have specified.
operations.title: Get Leaked Credentials

parameters.title: Keyword
parameters.name: q
parameters.tooltip: Specify the text to search in email address and breach name. Provided keyword will be searched in these fields: email, breach name, domain
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the text to search in email address and breach name. Specified keywords are searched in these fields: email, breach name, and domain. For example, if you specify user@example.com, the response filters out results and fetches credentials exposed for user@example.com.

parameters.title: Breach ID
parameters.name: breach_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the breach ID to filter the leaked credentials received.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the breach ID to filter the leaked credentials received.

parameters.title: Email ID
parameters.name: email
parameters.tooltip: Specify the email ID to filter the leaked credentials received.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the email ID to filter the leaked credentials retrieved.

parameters.title: Domain
parameters.name: domain
parameters.tooltip: Specify the domain to filter the leaked credentials received.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the domain to filter the leaked credentials retrieved.

parameters.title: Status
parameters.name: status
parameters.tooltip: Specify the status to filter the leaked credentials received.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the status to filter the leaked credentials retrieved. You can choose from ACTIVE, RESOLVED

parameters.name: has_password
parameters.title: Has Password
parameters.tooltip: Specify whether to filter the leaked credential list based on whether the credentials contain passwords.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify whether to filter the leaked credential list based on whether the credentials contain passwords. You can choose from True, False

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.tooltip: Specify the start date to filter the credential leak discovery date. Default is last 6 months.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the start date to filter the credential leak discovery date. Default is last 6 months.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.title: End Date
parameters.tooltip: Specify the end date to filter the credential leak discovery date. The default is the current day's date.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the end date to filter the credential leak discovery date. The default is the current day's date.

parameters.name: page
parameters.title: Page
parameters.tooltip: Specify the page number from which you want to retrieve records.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the page number from which you want to retrieve records. By default, it is set to 1.

parameters.name: size
parameters.title: Size
parameters.placeholder: Minimum permissible value is 0 and maximum is 500.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of records that this operation should return for the specified page. By default, this operation retrieves 10 records.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of records that this operation should return for the specified page. By default, this operation retrieves 10 records. Minimum permissible value is 0 and maximum is 500.

operations.title: Get Scan Statistics
operations.description: Retrieves statistics related to the EASM scan related to the organization ID specified in the configuration parameters. The response includes a count of the total, online, and newly discovered assets for the current and previous scans.

parameters.title: Tags In (Match Any)
parameters.name: tags_in
parameters.tooltip: Specify the tag ID to filter retrieved results. You can specify multiple tag IDs as comma-separated values. It returns results if it matches any of the specified tags, operating as an 'OR filter'.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the tag ID to filter retrieved results. You can specify multiple tag IDs as comma-separated values. It returns results if it matches any of the specified tags, operating as an 'OR filter'.

parameters.title: Tags In (Match All)
parameters.name: tags_match_all
parameters.tooltip: Specify the tag ID to filter retrieved results. You can specify multiple tag IDs as comma-separated values. It returns results if it matches all of the specified tags, operating as an 'AND filter'.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the tag ID to filter retrieved results. You can specify multiple tag IDs as comma-separated values. It returns results if it matches all of the specified tags, operating as an 'AND filter'.

parameters.title: Groups In (Match Any)
parameters.name: groups_in
parameters.tooltip: Specify the group ID to filter retrieved results. You can specify multiple group IDs as comma-separated values. It returns results if it matches any of the specified groups, operating as an 'OR filter'.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the group ID to filter retrieved results. You can specify multiple group IDs as comma-separated values. It returns results if it matches any of the specified groups, operating as an 'OR filter'.

parameters.title: Groups In (Match All)
parameters.name: groups_match_all
parameters.tooltip: Specify the group ID to filter retrieved results. You can specify multiple group IDs as comma-separated values. It returns results if it matches all of the specified groups, operating as an 'AND filter'.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the group ID to filter retrieved results. You can specify multiple group IDs as comma-separated values. It returns results if it matches all of the specified groups, operating as an 'AND filter'.

operations.title: Get Issues Discovered
operations.description: Retrieves a list of security issues related to assets discovered in the most recent EASM scan based on the filter criteria like issue status, severity, and the country codes (US, IN) you have specified.

parameters.name: status
parameters.title: Status
parameters.tooltip: Select the status to filter the results.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the status to filter the results. You can choose from the following options: Active, Resolved, Risk Accepted, False Positive

parameters.name: severity
parameters.title: Severity
parameters.tooltip: Select the severity to filter the results.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the severity to filter the results. You can choose from the following options: Critical, High, Medium or Low

parameters.name: countries
parameters.title: Countries
parameters.tooltip: Specify the country code to filter the discovered issues. Specify the countries as comma-separated values to get all those results that have any of the specified countries.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the country code to filter the discovered issues. Specify the countries as comma-separated values to get all those results that have any of the specified countries. For example: IN,US

parameters.name: bucket_id
parameters.title: Bucket ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify the bucket IDs to filter the results.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the bucket IDs to filter the results. You can choose from the following options: Exposed Remote Service Vulnerable Software Exposed Management Service Certificate Issues DNS Health (email) DNS Health Exposed Database Service Reputation Mis Configuration Missing Encryption Exposed Insecure Service

parameters.name: issue_name_identifier
parameters.title: Issue Name Identifier
parameters.tooltip: Specify the issue name identifiers to filter the results, as comma-separated values.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the issue name identifiers to filter the results, as comma-separated values. For example: ip_blacklist,cve_2019_1234

parameters.name: asset_type
parameters.title: Asset Type
parameters.tooltip: Select the asset type to filter the archived issues.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the asset type to filter the archived issues. You can choose from the following options: IP Address, ASN Number, Domain Name, Sub Domain, IP Prefix

parameters.name: asset
parameters.title: Asset
parameters.tooltip: Specify the asset to filter the results.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the asset to filter the results. For example: test.example.com

parameters.name: search_type
parameters.title: Search Type
parameters.tooltip: Specify the search type to filter the retrieved issues. NOTE: Use Asset parameter, along with this parameter, to search.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the search type to filter the retrieved issues. NOTE: Use Asset parameter, along with this parameter, to search. You can select from Exact, Begins with, Ends with or Wildcard

parameters.title: Tags In (Match Any)
parameters.name: tags_in
parameters.tooltip: Specify the tag ID to filter retrieved results. You can specify multiple tag IDs as comma-separated values. It returns results if it matches any of the specified tags, operating as an 'OR filter'.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the tag ID to filter retrieved results. You can specify multiple tag IDs as comma-separated values. It returns results if it matches any of the specified tags, operating as an 'OR filter'.

parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the tag ID to filter retrieved results. You can specify multiple tag IDs as comma-separated values. It returns results if it matches all of the specified tags, operating as an 'AND filter'.

parameters.name: groups_in
parameters.tooltip: Specify the group ID to filter retrieved results. You can specify multiple group IDs as comma-separated values. It returns results if it matches any of the specified groups, operating as an 'OR filter'.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the group ID to filter retrieved results. You can specify multiple group IDs as comma-separated values. It returns results if it matches any of the specified groups, operating as an 'OR filter'.

parameters.name: groups_match_all
parameters.tooltip: Specify the group ID to filter retrieved results. You can specify multiple group IDs as comma-separated values. It returns results if it matches all of the specified groups, operating as an 'AND filter'.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the group ID to filter retrieved results. You can specify multiple group IDs as comma-separated values. It returns results if it matches all of the specified groups, operating as an 'AND filter'.

parameters.name: after_primary_scan
parameters.title: After Primary Scan
parameters.tooltip: Select whether to fetch results for items created before or after the primary scan.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select whether to fetch results for items created before or after the primary scan. You can choose from following options: True: Select this option to fetch results for items created after the primary scan. False: Select this option to fetch results for items created before the primary scan.

parameters.name: page
parameters.title: Page
parameters.tooltip: Specify the page number from which you want to retrieve records.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the page number from which you want to retrieve records. By default, it is set to 1.

parameters.name: size
parameters.title: Size
parameters.placeholder: Minimum permissible value is 0 and maximum is 500.

parameters.name: issue_id

parameters.tooltip: Specify the issue ID to get details about that specific security issue.

parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the group ID to filter retrieved results. You can specify multiple group IDs as comma-separated values. It returns results if it matches all of the specified groups, operating as an 'AND filter'.

parameters.name: after_primary_scan

parameters.name: ports

parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the ports to filter the retrieved IP addresses. Specify the ports as comma-separated values to get only those results that have ALL of the specified ports. For example: 8080,443.

parameters.title: Report ID
parameters.description: Specify the report ID to retrieve the report details.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the report ID to retrieve the report details.

parameters.name: get_link
parameters.title: Get Report Link
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the checkbox to get an S3 link of report file. Clear the checkbox to retrieve file data. By default, this checkbox is cleared, i.e., set to false.
parameters.tooltip: If set to True then S3 link of report file will be retrieved else it will retrieve file data.

operations.title: Get Exposed Services
operations.description: Retrieves a list of exposed services in the latest EASM scan based on the filter criteria like asset, ports, services, and products, etc.

parameters.name: asset
parameters.title: Asset
parameters.tooltip: Specify the asset, to filter the results, from retrieved exposed services. Note: The only supported asset types are the ip address, domain, sub-domain.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the asset to filter the retrieved exposed services. NOTE: The only supported asset types are the ip address, domain, sub-domain.

parameters.name: ports
parameters.title: Ports
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ports, to filter the results, from retrieved exposed services. Specify the ports as comma-separated values to get only those results that have all of the specified ports.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the ports to filter the retrieved exposed services. Specify the ports as comma-separated values to get only those results that have ALL of the specified ports. For example: 8080,443.

parameters.name: services
parameters.title: Services
parameters.tooltip: Specify the services, to filter the results, from retrieved exposed services. Specify a comma-separated string or a single string. It will return results if it matches any of the specified services, operating as an 'OR filter'
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the services to filter the retrieved exposed services. Specify the services as comma-separated values to get only those results that have ANY of the specified services. For example: http,https.

parameters.name: products
parameters.title: Products
parameters.tooltip: Specify the products, to filter the results, from retrieved exposed services. Specify a comma-separated string or a single string. It will return results if it matches any of the specified products, operating as an 'OR filter'.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the products to filter the retrieved exposed services. Specify a comma-separated string or a single string. For example: nginx, Jetty.

parameters.name: service_banner
parameters.title: Services Banner
parameters.tooltip: Specify the keywords in the service banner, to filter the results, from retrieved exposed services. Note: Please do not use *, it is implicitly added.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the keywords in the service banner to filter the retrieved exposed services. NOTE: Do not use *; it is added implicitly.

parameters.name: after_primary_scan
parameters.title: After Primary Scan
parameters.tooltip: Select whether to fetch the list of assets that are added after primary scan.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select whether to fetch results for items created before or after the primary scan. You can choose from following options: True: Select this option to fetch results for items created after the primary scan. False: Select this option to fetch results for items created before the primary scan.

parameters.name: has_ssl
parameters.title: Has SSL
parameters.tooltip: Select whether to fetch assets which have SSL.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select whether to fetch assets which have SSL. You can choose from following options: True: Select this option to fetch assets which have SSL. False: Select this option to fetch assets.

parameters.name: page
parameters.title: Page
parameters.tooltip: Specify the page number from which you want to retrieve records.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the page number from which you want to retrieve records. By default, it is set to 1.

parameters.name: size
parameters.title: Size
parameters.placeholder: Minimum permissible value is 0 and maximum is 500.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of records that this operation should return for the specified page. By default, this operation retrieves 10 records.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of records that this operation should return for the specified page. By default, this operation retrieves 10 records. Minimum permissible value is 0 and maximum is 500.

operations.title: Update Archived Asset
operations.description: Update the given asset ID status to active. It removes the given asset from archived assets but its linked assets will still be there in the archived.Asset will be shown on the profile settings seeds section immediately. However, asset will get scanned again within 24 hours and will be shown on the active assets, if any issues found during scan those will be shown on the issues page.

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.title: Asset ID
parameters.description: Specify the archived asset ID to update the status to active.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the archived asset ID to update the status to active.

operations.title: Update Issue Status
operations.description:
Updates the status of the Security issue record.
 If the given issue status is set to false_positive or risk_accepted then issue will be visible in the archived issues.

parameters.name: issue_id
parameters.title: Issue ID
parameters.description: Specify the security issue ID to update the status.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the security issue ID to update the status.

parameters.title: Status
parameters.name: status
parameters.tooltip: Specify the status to update the security issue.
parameters.description: Specify the status to update the security issue. You can choose from ACTIVE, RESOLVED, FALSE_POSITIVE, RISK_ACCEPTED.

operations.title: Update ASN Asset To False Positive
operations.description:
This API endpoint mark the given asset ID as false positive,
 it will also mark all its linked assets to false positive. 
 Once assets are marked as false positive then those will be visible in the archived assets.
 All the issues which are found on the given asset will also get removed/deleted from the issues.

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.title: Asset ID
parameters.description: Specify the ASN asset ID to update it to False Positive.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ASN asset ID to update it to False Positive.
